New Records: LeBron James tied Michael Jordan for most 30-point games in NBA history.
LeBron James became the second-oldest player ever to make seven three-pointers in a game.
Key Match Events: LeBron James scored 38 points, including a season-high seven three-pointers.
Max Christie scored a career-best 28 points and made five three-pointers.
Austin Reaves finished with 11 assists, eight rebounds, and 15 points despite shooting five for 15 from the field.
Anfernee Simons led Portland with 23 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Anthony Davis missed the game due to lingering soreness in his sprained left ankle.
Gabe Vincent was also out due to an oblique strain.
Post-Match Reflections: LeBron James expressed the need for everyone to step up in Anthony Davis' absence.
JJ Redick praised Max Christie's growth and reliability.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Lakers' defense found its footing in the second and third quarters.
The Lakers host Atlanta on Friday night before playing key road games against Houston and Dallas.
